page.title: 01LANDSCAPE OF ST ABBS
page.content: LANDSCAPE ST ABBS.ST ABBS IS A SMALL FISHING VILLAGE ON THE EAST COAST OF SCOTLAND. IT IS SITUATED SOME 14 MILES NORTH OF BERWICK UPON TWEED ON THE SCOTTISH SIDE OF THE BORDER.THE POPULATION OF THE VILLAGE IS 143 ADULTS AND 45 CHILDREN. 27 MEN WORK IN THE FISHING INDUSTRY.THERE ARE 77 PERMANENT HOMES AND 15 HOLIDAY HOMES IN ST ABBS.THERE ARE NO HOTELS BUT 9 BED AND BREAKFAST ESTABLISHMENTS.LOTS OF TOURISTS VISIT ST ABBS TO LOOK AT PICTURESQE HARBOUR AND TO VISIT THE NATURE RESERVE AT ST ABBS HEAD.MANY PEOPLE COME TO DIVE BECAUSE THE SEA IS VERY CLEAR ROUND THE VOLCANIC CLIFFS AND MANY DIFFERENT KINDS OF FISH AND SEA CREATURES ARE FOUND ROUND THIS BEAUTIFUL PART OF THE COAST .
